commands.name: cd
commands.example: > cd folder2 ( folder1 => folder2) cd .. (goes back a directory)

commands.name: mv
commands.use: Moves a file or renames it
commands.example: > mv Path/to/file Where/you/are/moving/it (moves file from point a to point b or 'mv 'path/to/filename' 'path/to/newfilename' renames it

commands.name: whatis
commands.example: > whatis 'command' (says one line use for it)

commands.name: cd
commands.example: > cd folder2 ( folder1 => folder2) cd .. (goes back a directory)

commands.name: move
commands.use: Moves a file or renames it
commands.example: > move Path/to/file Where/you/are/moving/it (moves file from point a to point b or 'move 'path/to/filename' 'path/to/newfilename' renames it

commands.name: call
commands.use: calls a batch file from another one

commands.name: whatis
commands.example: > whatis 'command' (says one line use for it)

commands.name: du
commands.use: List usage for each subdirectory and its contents

commands.name: du -sh [folder]
commands.use: Human readable output of all files in a directory

commands.name: du -s
commands.use: Display an entry for each specified file

commands.name: du -sk* | sort -nr
commands.use: List files and folders/subfolders, totaling the size.

commands.name: df -h
commands.use: Calculate your system's free disk space

commands.name: df -H
commands.use: Calculate your system's free disk space in powers of 1000

commands.name: man [command]
commands.use: Show the help manual of the command

commands.name: cd -
commands.use: Previous directory or folder you last browsed

commands.name: cd..
commands.use: Move up to the parent directory

commands.name: ls
commands.use: Display the name of files and subdirectories in the directory

commands.name: ls -C
commands.use: Force multi-column output of the listing

commands.name: ls -a
commands.use: List all entries including those with .(period) and ..(double period)

commands.name: ls -1
commands.use: Output the list of files in one entry per line format

commands.name: ls -F
commands.use: Display a / (slash) immediately after each path that is a directory

commands.name: ls -S
commands.use: Sort files or entries by size

commands.name: ls -lh
commands.use: Long listing with human readable file sizes

commands.name: ls -lo
commands.use: List the file names with size, owner, and flags

commands.name: ls -la
commands.use: List detailed directory contents, including hidden files

commands.name: rmdir <dir>
commands.use: Delete a folder (only works on empty folders)

commands.name: rm -R <dir>
commands.use: Delete a folder and its contents

commands.name: touch <file>
commands.use: Create a new file without any extension

commands.name: cp <file> <dir>
commands.use: Copy the file to the folder

commands.name: cp <file> <newfile>
commands.use: Copy a file to the current folder

commands.name: cp <file>~/<dir>/<newfile>
commands.use: Copy a file to the folder and rename the copied file

commands.name: cp <file1> <file2> <file3>/Users/<dir>
commands.use: Copy multiple files to a folder

commands.name: cp -i <file><dir>
commands.use: Prompts you before copying a file with a warning overwrite message

commands.name: rm -i <file>
commands.use: Delete a file only when you give confirmation

commands.name: rm <file1> <file2> <file3>
commands.use: Delete multiple files without any confirmation

commands.name: mv <file> <dir>
commands.use: Move a file to the folder, possibly by overwriting an existing file

commands.name: mv -i <file> <dir>
commands.use: Optional -i flag to warn you before overwriting the file

commands.name: mv *.png ~/<dir>
commands.use: Move all PNG files from current folder to a different folder

commands.name: history n
commands.use: Shows the previous commands you've typed

commands.name: ls -ld
commands.use: Display the default permission for a home directory

commands.name: ls -ld/<dir>
commands.use: Display the read, write, and access permission of a particular folder

commands.name: chmod 755 <file>
commands.use: Change the permission of a file to 755

commands.name: chmod -R 600 <dir>
commands.use: Change the permission of a folder (and its contents) to 600

commands.name: chown <user>:<group> <file>
commands.use: Change the ownership of a file to user and group. Add -R to include folder contents

commands.name: ps -ax
commands.use: Output currently running processes. Here, a shows processes from all users and x shows processes that are not connected with the Terminal

commands.name: ps -aux
commands.use: Shows all the processes with %cpu, %mem, page in, PID, and command

commands.name: top
commands.use: Display live information about currently running processes

commands.name: top -ocpu -s 5
commands.use: Display processes sorted by CPU usage, updating every 5 seconds

commands.name: kill PID
commands.use: Quit process with ID <PID>. You'll see PID as a column in the Activity Monitor

commands.name: ps -ax | grep <appname>
commands.use: Find a process by name or PID

commands.name: whois <domain>
commands.use: Output whois info for a domain

commands.name: curl -O <url/to/file>
commands.use: Download file via HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP

commands.name: ssh <username>@<host>
commands.use: Establish SSH connection to <host> with user <username>

commands.name: brew upgrade
commands.use: Upgrade all outdated and unpinned brews

commands.name: brew update
commands.use: Fetch latest version of homebrew and formula

commands.name: brew cleanup
commands.use: Remove older version of installed formula

commands.name: brew tap homebrew/cask
commands.use: Tap the cask repository from GitHub

commands.name: find <dir> -name <'file'>
commands.use: Find all files named <file> inside <dir>. Use wildcards (*) to search for parts of filenames

commands.name: grep '<text>' <file>
commands.use: Output all occurrences of <text> inside <file> (add -i for case insensitivity)

commands.name: grep -rl '<text>' <dir>
commands.use: Search for all files containing <text> inside <dir>

commands.name: less <file>
commands.use: Output the contents of <file> using the less command that supports pagination and more

flags.name: ![value]
flags.use: Execute the last command typed that starts with a value

commands.name: add
commands.use: add 1 or more file to staging

commands.name: push
commands.use: Send changes to branch in repository

commands.name: status
commands.use: List files change and ones to commit

commands.name: remote add origin <server>
commands.use: add connection from repository to remote server

commands.name: checkout -b
commands.use: create new branch and switch to it

commands.name: checkout
commands.use: switch from one branch to another

commands.name: branch
commands.use: lists al branches, says current branch

commands.name: pull
commands.use: fetches and merges changes on remote server

commands.name: merge
commands.use: merge different branch into active branch

commands.name: diff
commands.example: > git diff or > git diff --base file or git diff branchone branchtwo

commands.name: revert
commands.use: adds new head at end undoing last commit

commands.name: stash
commands.use: Stash changes in a dirty working directory
